resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
etseidl opened a new pull request #11131:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11131


   This PR adds observer pointers to TypedColumnWriterImpl to avoid repeated dynamic_casts upon writing many small batches.  This can lead to significant performance gains.


--

emkornfield commented on a change in pull request #11131:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11131#discussion_r706906066



##########
File path: cpp/src/parquet/column_writer.cc
##########
@@ -1358,6 +1363,8 @@ class TypedColumnWriterImpl : public ColumnWriterImpl, public TypedColumnWriter<
       // Only PLAIN encoding is supported for fallback in V1
       current_encoder_ = MakeEncoder(DType::type_num, Encoding::PLAIN, false, descr_,
                                      properties_->memory_pool());
+      current_value_encoder_ = dynamic_cast<ValueEncoderType*>(current_encoder_.get());
+      current_dict_encoder_ = 0;  // not using dict

Review comment:
       ```suggestion
         current_dict_encoder_ = nullptr;  // not using dict
   ```




--

etseidl commented on pull request #11131:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11131#issuecomment-918384581


   Right now I'm trying to modify the stream_reader_writer example to see if the speed bump is noticeable there.  If not, I'll  modify my code (which doesn't actually use the streaming api, it just writes in batches of 1) to  do writes to a fixed schema.


--

etseidl commented on pull request #11131:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11131#issuecomment-918406821


   Ok, I modified the stream_reader_writer example to just do the write, and changed the number of rows from 2000 to 20M (and the max row group size from 1000 to 10M).  I ran this on my laptop with and without the changes in this patch.  I used the csh time command to compare run times. The results are:
   ```
   original:
   52.919u 2.146s 0:55.81 98.6%	0+0k 0+2646928io 0pf+0w
   53.328u 2.327s 0:56.38 98.6%	0+0k 0+2646928io 0pf+0w
   53.048u 2.341s 0:56.06 98.7%	0+0k 0+2646928io 0pf+0w
   
   patched:
   35.367u 2.012s 0:37.88 98.6%	0+0k 0+2646928io 0pf+0w
   35.133u 1.717s 0:37.36 98.6%	0+0k 0+2646928io 0pf+0w
   35.228u 1.950s 0:37.61 98.8%	0+0k 0+2646928io 0pf+0w
   ```
   @emkornfield Do you want benchmark code added to the PR, or are these results sufficient?


--

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
The methods WriteDictionaryPage(), CheckDictionarySizeLimit(), WriteValues(), and WriteValuesSpaced() in TypedColumnWriterImpl (cpp/src/parquet/column_writer.cc) perform dynamic_casts of the current_dict_ object to either DictEncoder or ValueEncoderType pointers.  When calling WriteBatch() with a large number of values this is ok, but when writing batches of 1 (as when using the stream api), these dynamic casts can consume a great deal of cpu.  Using gperftools against code I wrote to do a log structured merge of several parquet files, I measured the dynamic_casts taking as much as 25% of execution time.

By modifying TypedColumnWriterImpl to save downcasted observer pointers of the appropriate types, I was able to cut my execution time from 32 to 24 seconds, validating the gpertools results.  I've attached a patch to show what I did.
fields.summary: [C++] dynamic_casts in parquet TypedColumnWriterImpl impacting performance
fields.environment: arrow 6.0.0-SNAPSHOT on both RHEL8 (gcc 8.4.1) and MacOS 11.5.2 (clang 11.0.0)

comments.body: This looks a nice improvement. Will you created a PR? Thanks.
